title: What it's like to fight Jax during URF

replies.body:
+1 for Grievous when he was still a badass. Surrounded? Better show off more.

http://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/11120/111202517/4359711-grievous-o.gif

What do you mean still a badass? Grievous is still a complete badass. I mean I know transitioning from the cartoon to live action had the potential to really mess up his character, but since Episode III was never released, we never had to deal with something like that.

Yep... real glad Grievous was never tarnished by the live action movies...

and the 2008 animated series, or are we still acting like that never happened?

Either way they made him a bitch in that series. I don't think he even killed anyone.

It makes sense if you think about it.

In a series where the Jedi are the ultimate badasses if you introduce a character that takes on multiple jedi knights and wins it sort of defeats the entire series. It'd be like if a series named "dragons are awesome" had king kong stomp like 10 dragons down in the middle of it.

Yes and no; while I agree introducing a character that defeats the resident badasses solely to exemplify their superiority is a poor decision, doing so to remind audiences the heroes are not infallible is perfectly reasonable.

In relation to Grievous' introduction, the Jedi had already dealt with countless droids, survived a crash landing, and were still fighting off an overwhelming force. They were _exhausted_ by the time Grievous arrived, and he manipulated their fatigue by shaping it into fear, disrupting them. The General had an incredible advantage before even setting foot near the group.

Later episodes depict him as competent, but more importantly, terrifyingly relentless. He was still a threat, but no where near unstoppable as his first appearance made him out to be. Grievous' victories over individual Jedi are, notably, after he has run them into the ground. By being a cybernetic organism, he has the advantage of stamina, capable of outlasting any organic adversary, and he abuses it.

That relentlessness fit his character. Even prior to becoming the General, he was an exceptional soldier. Having lost many loved ones, witnessed the suffering his people after being denied aid by the Republic, and finally, led to believe the Jedi were the source of all his problems, he became solely focussed on their destruction. He was _remade_ to fulfill that purpose; everything about Grievous was built around eliminating Jedi, so it makes sense he is frighteningly effective against them.

He had one job: prove that the Jedi were not invincible, and, at least initially, he did.

We all know the hero wins at the end, that is what stories have led us to believe, and typically, that assumption holds true to this day. But when victory is assured and nothing is at risk, a story becomes boring, we lose any sort of connection to the hero because we _can_ fail, we _do_ lose.

To end my rambling, I like Grievous because he made me think, "maybe they can lose" and that strengthened the investment in learning what happened next. He put the story's outcome in question, and that made it all the more exciting.

Plus, cyborgs are awesome.

Plus seeing Grievous grab Jedi faces and slam them into the ground was pretty satisfying lol. I've always hated standard Jedi and always loved anyone who could stand against them. Break the meta Grievous!

https://33.media.tumblr.com/7b398c657eff1fd0f4db97676af090b3/tumblr_ng8c3ovauR1u3l1g3o8_250.gif

Hell yeah.

http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20061125041234/starwars/images/5/54/DarthBane-frontal.jpg

Darth Bane would like to have some words with you.
He did kill Kit Fisto's former padawan in that series. It was the episode where they find Grievous's lair.

He then went into a 4v1 against Kit Fisto and lost.

Him being the four.

God this Grievous was amazing.

http://i.imgur.com/xA3yA8n.gif

Doesn't even have his second pair of sabers out yet and he's still kicking butt.

Grievous is one of my top 2 favorite Cyborgs right alongside {{champion:112}}

I LOL'd 
10/10 would watch again
I like how a bunch of Jedis can't figure out how to counter the infamous arms-out spin move.
They were all probably scared and confused, it's funny because URF Jax makes you feel the same way.

Clearly they aren't as advanced as Runeterra if they haven't figured out the [tactical combat spin.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/uhpKpAWb-the-real-questions-lore-should-answer-who-invented-the-tactical-combat-spin)

lol just the thought of Grievous playing too much League one day thinking to himself. 

"I can do that."
I sense an upcoming 'Grievous Garen' skin for some reason...

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Whist,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lPgyQNRO,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2015-04-04T06:04:00.578+0000)
>
> I like how a bunch of Jedis can't figure out how to counter the infamous arms-out spin move.

When they changed the Jedi Council requirement to be "must have one really weird physical feature and/or be Samuel Jackson", things really went downhill.

Minion farming with relentless assault...
http://i.imgur.com/Ni2pHad.gif

Amazing

where did you find that?
Dunno. Can't remember lol. I've had it saved for a long time I just haven't had a reason to use it until now.
Completely inaccurate. Jax would have killed all four in 1 second.
Jax pays with his prey.

> [{quoted}](name=Dragonzzilla,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=lPgyQNRO,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2015-04-04T06:58:58.750+0000)

> Jax pays with his prey.

{{champion:24}}: "Hello, shop keep, I'd like to purchase a {{item:3153}}, please."
SHOP: "And how will you be paying for this today?"
{{champion:24}}: "Do you accept the corpses of my fallen enemies?"

lol i love general grievous.
I played him a shitload in SW:battlefront 2.
Still my favorite shooter I've ever played, even if Grievous, Maul, and anyone with Force Choke were HORRIBLY imbalanced for Mos Eisley Assault...
I'd always play Boba or Jango, fly on top of the dick shaped pillar and rain down missile fire.
Until that Kit Fisto sends your rocket back at you. ;D
http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20070310153928/starwars/images/8/8f/Kit_Smile.jpg

I prefered SW:battlefront in terms of map creations and map flow.

But flying maps were really good in sw:b 2 so thats fun too.
If they make SW:b3 some shitty battlefield knock off I'm going to shit bricks

There's so much they can do with space combat.
So much to build on.
Make the ships fully fleshed out and invadable/defensiable...
Just so much to do there, hope they don't take they lazy way out or I'll never even rent the game let alone buy it.
The Light-copter looks like average Hecarim gameplay

The Force is strong with this post.
It's too bad they got rid of executioner's calling. (Grievous Wounds)
This makes me want to play Jax on URF now. xD
10/10 for using a great animation that is the TRUE clone wars

I hate how Luscas arts decided to retcon Alpha 17 for Captain Rex.  I know Aplha's story was pretty, out there, considering it was implied that Ventress raped him but hey was the character that triggered your. "its about to go down." alarm whenever he was mentioned and one of the few dark characters of Star Wars.

To impress a chick, do the helicopter dick.

_Allright_

Actually, that looks more like Garen or Wukong on URF.

Spin to win baby.
+1 for using the awesome clone wars series...the 3d one was alright but, nothing compared to this. It did have it's moments though.

Omg, so true and so funny. Thank you for this!
